content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new structures have been successfully built on the map. The agent made several attempts to supply a Lab at position (0.5, y=2.5) by either retrieving existing labs or placing a new one. However, all placement and crafting attempts failed because the Lab was not present in the inventory and required sub-ingredients were missing. Operations such as smelting in furnaces (e.g. the furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) for iron plates and the copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) for copper plates) were performed but do not count as newly created structures.

ERROR TIPS
• API Misuse for Entity Retrieval
 – When calling get_entities, verify the function signature to ensure that only supported arguments are passed. Avoid using unsupported keyword arguments (e.g. “radius”) or providing unexpected positional arguments.

• Lab Placement and Inventory Issues
 – Confirm that the Lab is available in the inventory before attempting to place it at (0.5, 2.5).
 – Before iterating over the list of retrieved lab entities, ensure that the collection is not None to prevent iteration errors.

• Insufficient Resources for Lab Crafting
 – Ensure that all required sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) are available or producible using the available crafting and smelting facilities.
 – Address shortages by confirming that intermediate items (e.g. iron plates, copper plates) are produced in sufficient quantities before initiating Lab production.
 – Reassess the resource flow so that missing ingredients (for example, the noted shortage of iron-gear-wheels) are remedied prior to subsequent crafting attempts.
